snippet: For novice investors in racehorses, buying into a syndicate with several horses is a good way to learn an unpredictable business without huge financial losses.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column recommends that novice racehorse investors buy shares in a syndicate that owns several horses; notes that syndicates act like mutual funds, providing a good way to learn an unpredictable business without incurring major losses.
lead_paragraph: For novice investors in racehorses, buying into a syndicate with several horses is a good way to learn an unpredictable business without huge financial losses.
